import {Link} from 'react-router-dom'; import {useEffect,useState} from 'react'; import {useParams} from 'react-router-dom'; //to get id of the course which help to fetch form database import axios from 'axios'; const baseUrl='http://127.0.0.1:8000/api'; function CourseDetail(){ const [courseData,setcourseData]=useState([]); const [chapterData,setChapterData]=useState([]); let {course_id}=useParams(); useEffect(()=>{ document.title='Course Detail'; try{ axios.get(baseUrl+'/course/'+course_id) .then((res)=>{ zzzzz setChapterData(res.data); }); }catch(error){ console.log(error); } },[]); return(

Course Tittle

Wait...it's not over though! The whole purpose of the algorithm is to customize the runtime correctly. Imagine if the range increases from 1-15 to 1-100. The compiler will check each number to determine whether it is divisible by 3 or 5. It would then run through the numbers again to check if the numbers are divisible by 3 and 5. The code would essentially have to run through each number in the array twice â€” it would have to runs the numbers by 3 first and then run it by 5.
